front.name: British Reinforcements (2nd Army)
front.text: 2nd Army, 1 corps

front.name: Blockade
front.text: Subtract 1 VP during the War Status Phase of each Winter turn.

front.name: Russian Reinforcements (11th Army)
front.text: 11th Army, 1 corps

front.name: Pleve
front.text: RU units get a +1 drm for an attack or defense.

front.name: Putnik
front.text: May only be played in 1914 and 1915. SB units get a +1 drm for an attack or defense.

front.name: Withdrawal
front.text: Defending units negate one required Corps step loss and instead must retreat 1 space. Full strength Attacking units may advance. If no Corps step(s) lost, an Army step loss may be negated. See rule 12.6 for details.

front.name: Severe Weather
front.text: Defending units in a mountain space in Fall/Winter or a swamp space in Spring/Fall get a +2 drm.

front.name: Russian Reinforcements (2 corps)
front.text: 2 corps

front.name: Moltke
front.text: May only be played in August or September 1914. CP Activation in Belgium or France costs 1 OPS per unit (not space) until the "Falkenhayn" card is played. All units must be activated in a space. Supersedes Sud Army and Eleventh army card effects.

front.name: French Reinforcements (10th Army)
front.text: 10th Army

front.name: Russian Reinforcements (9th Army, 10th Army)
front.text: 9th Army, 10th Army

front.name: Entrench
front.text: Place a Level 1 Trench (not improve a Level 1 to Level 2) in any space occupied by a supplied friendly Army. Both players may now entrench. Only one player may play this card as an event.

front.name: Rape of Belgium
front.text: May only be played if CP played "Guns of August". May only be played as an Event if the Allied War Status is still at Mobilization. Subtract 1 VP.

front.name: British Reinforcements (1st Army)
front.text: 1st Army, 1 corps

front.name: British Reinforcements (4th Army)
front.text: 4th Army, 1 corps

front.name: Romania
front.text: May not be played after "Fall of the Tsar". Romania joins the Allies. See 9.5.2.5 for restriction on play as a non-event when CP are at Total War.

front.name: Italy
front.text: Italy joins the Allies. Add 1 VP during the War Status Phase of each turn if unplayed after Allied War Commitment Level is Total War. See also 9.5.2.5 for restrictions on play as a non-event when CP are at Total War.

front.name: Hurricane Barrage
front.text: A BR attack adds a +1 drm. ANA, AUS, CND, or PT do not qualify as BR for this purpose.

front.name: Air Superiority
front.text: A BR or FR attack adds +1 drm. ANA, AUS, CND, or PT do not qualify as BR for this purpose.

front.name: British Reinforcements (AUS Corps, CND Corps)
front.text: AUS Corps, CND Corps

front.name: Phosgene Gas
front.text: A FR attack adds +1 drm.

front.name: Italian Reinforcements (5th Army)
front.text: 5th Army

front.name: Cloak and Dagger
front.text: Allied player may examine all cards in the CP player's hand and then conduct Operations using this card.

front.name: French Reinforcements (7th Army)
front.text: 7th Army

front.name: Russian Reinforcements (6th Army, 7th Army, 2 corps)
front.text: 6th Army, 7th Army, 2 corps

front.name: Lusitania
front.text: May only be played after "Blockade" and before "Zimmermann Telegram". Subtract 1 VP.

front.name: Great Retreat
front.text: All RU units attacked this turn may retreat before combat. This must be announced before flank attempts, play of combat cards, and die rolls. No combat resolution takes place. The RU unit(s) must retreat 1 space. Forts and non-RU units in the space are still attacked. Aborted CP attacks still count for MO purposes.

front.name: Landships
front.text: Allows play of "Royal Tank Corps".

front.name: Yudenitch (RU Reinforcements)
front.text: Place the Russian CAU Army in any supplied space in Russia on the Near East map. Can enter prior to TU entry.

front.name: Salonika
front.text: Allied player must SR at least one and up to 3 BR/FR Corps (from Allied ports and/or Reserve) only to Salonika (ANA, CND, AUS, or PT do not count). This counts as an SR action (see 9.3.3). May be played after Greek entry if Salonika is Allied controlled and subject to stacking limits. See also 9.5.2.4.

front.name: MEF (BR Reinforcements)
front.text: May only be played if Turkey is at war and before "Salonika". Place the MEF Army at any MEF space. See 9.5.3.5.
front.notes: may only be played if Turkey is at war and before Salonika

front.name: Russian Reinforcements (12th Army)
front.text: 12th Army

front.name: Grand Fleet
front.text: If played in the Allied Action Round immediately following the "High Seas Fleet", cancel that card. Cannot be played as an event at any other time.

front.name: British Reinforcements (3rd Army)
front.text: 3rd Army, 2 corps

front.name: Yanks and Tanks
front.text: Allied player conducts Operations using this card and all Combats involving a US unit during this Action Round get a +2 drm.

front.name: Mine Attack
front.text: A BR attack vs. an entrenched CP Defender adds a +1 drm. May only be used in one Combat per turn. ANA, AUS, CND, or PT do not qualify as BR for this purpose.

front.name: Independent Air Force
front.text: Cancel or prevent Rathenau Event bonus GE RP for the rest of the game.

front.name: USA Reinforcements (1 corps)
front.text: 1 corps. May only be played after "Over There".

front.name: They Shall Not Pass
front.text: Cancels any retreat for losing a Combat if defending in a non-destroyed FR fort space. A FR unit must be present in the space. Card remains face up until a combat is lost.

front.name: 14 Points
front.text: May only be played after "Zimmermann Telegram". Only the Allied player may offer Peace Terms for the rest of the game. Subtract 1 VP.

front.name: Arab Northern Army (BR Reinforcements)
front.text: May only be played if Turkey is at war. Place the British ANA Corps in the Arabia space. See 11.1.15.
front.notes: may only be played if Turkey is at war

front.name: British Reinforcements (5th Army)
front.text: 5th Army, 1 corps, PT Corps.

front.name: USA Reinforcements (1st Army)
front.text: 1st Army, 2 corps. May only be played after "Over There".

front.name: Greece
front.text: Greece joins the Allies. Play of Greece does not prevent play of MEF or Salonika.

front.name: Kerensky Offensive
front.text: May only be played after "Fall of the Tsar" and before the "Bolshevik Revolution". Allied player conducts Operations using this card and one RU attack vs. a space with any AH, BU, or TU units adds a +2 drm. AP player announces intent to use this drm prior to the CP player's use of defensive CC.

front.name: Brusilov Offensive
front.text: Allied player conducts Operations using this card and adds a +1 drm to ALL RU attacks this Action Round. Also for 1 RU attack vs. only non-GE CP units cancel all trench effects. The negation of trench effects must be announced prior to the Attempt Flank Attack Step.

front.name: USA Reinforcements (2nd Army)
front.text: 2nd Army, 1 corps. May only be played after "Over There".

front.name: Royal Tank Corps
front.text: May only be played after "Landships". Cancels trench column shifts for a BR attack against a clear space in France/Belgium/Germany. Does not cancel trench effects for flanking, Fortified Machine Guns CC, or negation of retreat. May only be used in 1 Combat per turn. ANA, AUS, CND, or PT do not qualify as BR for this purpose.

front.name: Sinai Pipeline
front.text: Cancels Sinai -3 drm for Allied units only. Place Sinai Pipeline marker in the Sinai space. Can be played regardless of who controls Sinai and the effect cannot be reversed. Summer turn desert effects remain. Allows play of "Allenby".

front.name: Allenby (BR Reinforcements)
front.text: May only be played after "Sinai Pipeline". Place the British NE Army in Alexandria. See 9.5.3.4.

front.name: Everyone into Battle
front.text: May only be played after at least one of the following has occurred: "Blucher," "Michael" or "Peace Offensive." Allied units in Italy, France and Belgium are considered one nationality for Activation for the rest of this turn (only). Rule 12.1.11 still applies.

front.name: Convoy
front.text: May only be played after "U-Boats Unleashed". Cancels effects of that card. Subtract 1 VP.

front.name: Army of the Orient (FR Reinforcements)
front.text: Place the French Orient Army in the Salonika space if Allied controlled, subject to stacking limits. See 9.5.3.4.

front.name: Zimmermann Telegram
front.text: May only be played if U.S. Entry marker is in the "Zimmermann Telegram Allowed" box. Subtract 1 VP. US joins the Allies. Allows play of "Over There" card on any following turn.

front.name: Over There
front.text: May be played on any turn after "Zimmermann Telegram". Allows play of "USA Reinforcements." ALL Allied RP cards played now include 1 US RP.

front.name: Paris Taxis
front.text: Allied player receives 1 extra RP to immediately flip a reduced French Army in or adjacent to Paris to its full strength side. The RP may not be spent to replace an eliminated unit.

front.name: Russian Cavalry
front.text: Place the two Russian cavalry corps in any one space inside Russia containing a supplied Russian Army. They may not be placed in violation of the stacking limit. May not operate in the NE. They may not replace an eliminated Russian Army.

front.name: Russian Guards
front.text: A RU attack adds +1 drm.

front.name: Alpine Troops
front.text: An attack only involving IT units adds +1 drm.

front.name: Czech Legion
front.text: Remove from the game 1 AH Corps from the CP Eliminated/Replacement Box. Add the RU Czech Legion Corps to the AP Reserve Box. This Corps is treated as Russian for all purposes but it may not replace an eliminated Russian Army.

front.name: Maude
front.text: Any one attack made by BR units tracing supply to Basra may fire on the Army Table.

front.name: The Sixtus Affair
front.text: Roll on the Allied 0-19 Peace Terms Table. This event does not qualify as a Peace Offer and may not be accepted for a draw.

front.name: Backs to the Wall
front.text: A space with a BR Army in France/Belgium may cancel any one mandated retreat. This CC is permanently discarded regardless of whether a retreat is mandated by the combat results.

front.name: USA Reinforcements (2 corps)
front.text: 2 corps. May only be played after "Over There".

front.name: Influenza
front.text: May be played if Combined War Status is 30+. Neither side may perform RP actions for the rest of this turn. Already played RPs are not lost.

front.name: Guns of August
front.text: May only be played in the first Action Round of the August 1914 turn. The Liege fort is destroyed. Place the GE 1st and 2nd Armies in the Liege space. The GE 1st, 2nd, and 3rd Armies are activated for Combat.

front.name: Wireless Intercepts
front.text: Play in Attempt Flank Attack step. A Flank Attack Attempt involving at least one GE unit (army or corps) vs. a space containing only RU units is automatically successful. Play prior to Attempt Flank Attack Step.

front.name: Von Francois
front.text: A GE attack vs. RU units adds a +1 drm. May be used against spaces with RU and other nationalities.

front.name: Severe Weather
front.text: Defending units in a mountain space in Fall/Winter or a swamp space in Spring/Fall get a +2 drm.

front.name: Landwehr
front.text: CP player receives 2 extra RPs to immediately flip supplied reduced strength German units to their full strength side. They may not be spent to replace eliminated units. May not be played if Berlin is AP controlled or out of supply.

front.name: Entrench
front.text: Place a Level 1 Trench (not improve a Level 1 to Level 2) in any space occupied by a supplied friendly Army. Both players may now entrench. Only one player may play this card as an event.

front.name: German Reinforcements (9th Army)
front.text: 9th Army

front.name: Race to the Sea
front.text: CP units may now end movement in Ostend, Calais, and Amiens. Card may also be played as an event after CP War Status is at 4 or higher.

front.name: Reichstag Truce
front.text: May not be played after CP War Commitment Level is Total War. Add 1 VP.
front.notes: may not be played after CP goes to Total War

front.name: Sud Army
front.text: One AH unit and up to 2 GE corps may stack together and be Activated for a cost of 1 OPS point. A different stack may be chosen each Action Round. If a second AH unit or a second non-GE corps unit is present, then the activation cost is 2 OPS points. This event does not supersede rule 12.1.11.

front.name: Oberost
front.text: German units may now attack spaces containing RU forts. (They may always besiege such spaces). May still be played for War Status after CP War Status is 4 or higher.

front.name: German Reinforcements (10th Army)
front.text: 10th Army, 2 corps

front.name: Falkenhayn
front.text: May only be played on Aug/Sep 1914 turns only after "Moltke" is played or without restriction beginning Fall 1914. Cancels the effect of "Moltke". Allows play of "Place of Execution".

front.name: Austria-Hungary Reinforcements (7th Army)
front.text: 7th Army, 2 corps

front.name: Chlorine Gas
front.text: A GE attack adds +1 drm.

front.name: Liman von Sanders
front.text: A TU (SN unit does not count) attack or defense adds a +1 drm.

front.name: Mata Hari
front.text: CP player may examine all cards in the Allied player's hand and then conduct Operations using this card.

front.name: Fortified Machine Guns
front.text: A GE entrenched defender adds a +1 drm.

front.name: Flamethrowers
front.text: A GE attack adds +1 drm.

front.name: Austria-Hungary Reinforcements (10th Army)
front.text: 10th Army

front.name: German Reinforcements (11th Army)
front.text: 11th Army, 1 corps

front.name: German Reinforcements (12th Army)
front.text: 12th Army, 1 corps

front.name: Austria-Hungary Reinforcements (11th Army)
front.text: 11th Army

front.name: Libyan Revolt
front.text: May only be played if there are no Allied units in the Libya space. Place the SN unit in Libya. SN unit is always in supply. Spaces converted by the SN unit are checked normally during the Attrition phase. See 11.1.6.

front.name: High Seas Fleet
front.text: High Seas Fleet sorties. Unless the Allied player plays the "Grand Fleet" as his next action, add 1 VP.

front.name: Place of Execution
front.text: May only be played after "Falkenhayn" and before "H-L Take Command". A GE attack vs. an undestroyed FR fort space adds a +2 drm. May be played alone as an event (for War Status) if all FR forts are already destroyed.

front.name: Zeppelin Raids
front.text: Subtract 4 BR RPs from the BR RP total during the Replacement Phase of this turn.

front.name: Tsar Takes Command
front.text: May only be played if the Russian Capitulation marker is in the "Tsar Takes Command Allowed" box. See 16.4
front.notes: may only be played if the Russian Capitulation marker is in the Tsar Takes Command Allowed box

front.name: 11th Army
front.text: The GE 11th Army (only) and any CP Corp(s) may stack together and be Activated for a cost of 1 OPS point. If a second CP army is present, then the activation cost for the space is 2 OPS points. Event can be played prior to German 11th Army Reinforcement Event and also if GE 11th is already permanently eliminated. This event does not supersede rule 12.1.11.

front.name: Alpenkorps
front.text: A GE attack to or from a mountain space adds +1 drm.

front.name: Kemal
front.text: A TU unit defender (SN unit does not count) with a combat factor of 1 or more may fire on the Army Table. May only be used in one Combat per turn. If after a flank attack the required TU unit with a combat factor of 1 or more is no longer present, convert the remaining factors from the Corps Fire Table to the Army Fire Table (round "0" Corps Fire Table column up to the "1" Army Fire Table Column)

front.name: War in Africa
front.text: Permanently remove 1 full strength BR corps on the map or in the Reserve Box from the game or add 1 VP (Allied choice). If a full strength BR corps is not available, then a reduced BR corps may be used. ANA, AUS, CND, BEF, or PT do not qualify as BR for this purpose.

front.name: Walter Rathenau
front.text: Add 1 extra GE RP during the Replacement Phase of every turn even if the CP did not play Replacements on a turn. Can be played for War Status after "Independent Air Force".

front.name: Bulgaria
front.text: Bulgaria joins the CP.

front.name: Mustard Gas
front.text: A GE attack adds +1 drm.

front.name: U-Boats Unleashed
front.text: May only be played after "H-L Take Command". Subtract 1 BR RP during the Replacement Phase of each turn and prevent play of "US Reinforcements" until "Convoy" is played.

front.name: Hoffmann
front.text: Adds +1 to all future CP Mandated Offensive die rolls. May only be played after "H-L Take Command".

front.name: German Reinforcements (2 corps)
front.text: 2 corps

front.name: German Reinforcements (2 corps)
front.text: 2 corps

front.name: Air Superiority
front.text: A GE attack adds +1 drm.

front.name: German Reinforcements (14th Army)
front.text: 14th Army

front.name: Turkish Reinforcements (YLD Army)
front.text: YLD Army

front.name: Von Below
front.text: Cancels all trench effects for one GE attack against only IT unit(s).

front.name: Von Hutier
front.text: Attacker fires first and cancels all trench effects for a GE attack against a space containing RU unit(s). A trench does not need to be present. Play prior to Attempt Flank Attack Step. (Defending space may also contain other AP nationalities).

front.name: Treaty of Brest Litovsk
front.text: May only be played after "Bolshevik Revolution". RU units may no longer attack. CP units may not attack RU units except TU units may attack on the Near East map. Both sides may still move into unoccupied spaces and may still suffer attrition, besiege forts, and resolve sieges. Also see 5.5.2.

front.name: German Reinforcements (17th Army, 18th Army)
front.text: 17th Army, 18th Army

front.name: French Mutiny
front.text: Flip Allied MO markers to "FR Mutiny" side. Current and future FR MOs are considered FR Mutiny while the MO marker is in the FR box. If any FR units not stacked with US units attack on a FR Mutiny turn, add 1 VP for the turn (not for each attack). FR Mutiny does not apply to attacks outside of FR, BE, GE. No attack is ever required during an FR Mutiny turn.

front.name: Turkish Reinforcements (AoI Army)
front.text: AoI Army

front.name: Michael
front.text: May only be played after "H-L Take Command". Cancels all trench effects for 1 GE attack and adds a +1 drm for that attack. Play prior to Attempt Flank Attack Step. A trench does not need to be present.

front.name: Blucher
front.text: May only be played after "H-L Take Command". Cancels all trench effects for 1 GE attack. Play prior to Attempt Flank Attack Step. A trench does not need to be present.

front.name: Peace Offensive
front.text: May only be played after "H-L Take Command". Cancels all trench effects for 1 GE attack. If attacker does not advance into the space, subtract 1 VP. Play prior to Attempt Flank Attack Step. A trench does not need to be present.

front.name: Fall of the Tsar
front.text: May only be played if Russian Capitulation marker is in the "Fall of Tsar Allowed" box (see 16.4). Add 1 VP plus an additional 2 VP if Romania is still neutral. Activation for combat of spaces containing RU units costs an extra OPS per RU unit beyond the first, regardless of whether these units participate in combat. RU corps may no  longer move (can still SR) between the To Caucasus Box and the Near East.
front.notes: may only be played if Russian Capitulation marker is in the Fall of the Tsar Allowed box

front.name: Bolshevik Revolution
front.text: May only be played if  Russian Capitulation marker is in the "Bolshevik Revolution Allowed" box. No more than 1 RU RP may be spent each turn. Current and future RU MOs become "None".

front.name: H-L Take Command
front.text: Allows play of "Michael", "Blucher", "Peace Offensive", "Hoffmann", and "U-Boats Unleashed". Prevents play of "Place of Execution". Current and future German MOs become "None".

front.name: Lloyd George
front.text: May not be played after Michael, Blucher, or Peace Offensive. No BR attacks vs. Level 2 entrenched GE units may be made for the rest of this turn. The effect of this card is canceled by play of Michael, Blucher, or Peace Offensive events. This event may mean that a BR MO cannot be fulfilled in a specific turn.

front.name: Withdrawal
front.text: Defending units negate one required Corps step loss and instead retreat 1 space. This also cancels any retreat caused by losing the combat. If no Corps step(s) lost, an Army step loss may be negated. See rule 12.6 for details.

front.name: Kaisertreu
front.text: An AH attack or defense adds +1 drm.

front.name: Stavka Timidity
front.text: May be played after Tsar Takes Command. No RU attacks vs. entrenched GE units (only) the rest of this turn. Mixed CP stacks may be attacked. This is a reusable event, place in the discard pile after use.

front.name: Polish Restoration
front.text: May be played if the CP currently controls Warsaw. Subtract 1 VP. Add the three Polish Corps to the CP Reserve Box. These Corps are treated as German for all purposes but may not be replaced if Warsaw is Allied.

front.name: Turk Determination
front.text: A TU Defender in any non-trench space is considered at Trench Level 1 for all purposes for that combat only. Brusilov Offensive can negate the trench effect of this card. The SN unit is not considered Turkish for the purpose of applying this combat card.

front.name: Haig
front.text: Entrenched GE units in France/Belgium/Germany may ignore all retreat results vs. attacks with BR units this turn. No effect after play of Michael, Blucher, or Peace Offensive.

front.name: Achtung: Panzer
front.text: A GE attack vs. a clear space adds +1 drm.

front.name: Russian Desertions
front.text: May be played after Fall of the Tsar. CP may reduce four 2-step RU units.

front.name: Alberich
front.text: May not be used if Allies play Royal Tank Corps or Yanks and Tanks. Cancels any one Allied attack in France/Belgium. Any Allied CC cards are considered not played. The aborted AP attack still counts for MO purposes.

front.name: Prince Max
front.text: May not be played after turn 16. Increases War Status by 3.
